title: What’s the most emotionally draining song you’ve ever heard? - Quora

response.answer_text: There's loads. Loads and loads. Jimmy Ruffin's “What Becomes of the Broken Hearted”. Plan B's “Mister Drug Dealer”. New Model Army 's “Red Earth”. The Jam's “Down in the Tube station at Midnight”. The Liminanas “Dimanche”, featuring Bertrand Belin. Bruce Springsteen's “Stolen Car”. Kate Bush's “The Hounds of Love”. Joy Division 's “Atmosphere”. “Kisi Raah Mein Kisi Mod Par” from the Bollywood 1970 film, Mere Humsafar. Sung by Lata and Mukesh.

It’s not so much a song although it was released on an album and it has a melody in the background. Radiohead - Fitter Happier I’m listening to it as I write this and my take on the piece is that it’s so emotionally draining due to the lack of sympathy purposely provided by the locutor by telling you everything you have to do in order to be “accepted” in a society. But by doing it you become less and less happy due to the rules and standards impossed. Kind of ironical in a way. Hare Krishna
